page.title: 01Rural Devon Ref 0276 0084
page.content: This most beautiful area of England is on the periphary of Dartmoor.It is mainly hilly farmland with streams in the valleys and woodland _ both coniferous and deciduous _ on the steeper escarpments.There are rocky heather_clad areas rising to over 1100ft and two tors _ Hingston and Blackingstone. It contains the small hamlet of Doccombe and a number of isolated farmsteads. All the roads are narrow,winding lanes bounded on either side by stone walls or by high banks surmounted by hedges which have already existed for hundreds of years.Some of these lanes run along high hill_sides giving wonderful views of the hills and valleys and away to the high moors.
